transcript:
which last out until, at the first pause, the guests rise with a rustle of dresses and say, "I am so delighted . . . Mamma's health . . . and Countess Apraksina . . ." and then, again rustling, pass into the anteroom, put on cloaks or mantles, and drive away. The conversation was on the chief topic of the day: the illness of the wealthy and celebrated beau of Catherine's day, Count Bezukhov,and about his illegitimate son Pierre, the one who had 
behaved so improperly at Anna Pdvlovna's
